thread.title: Hashtag calls for Star Wars boycott
thread.title_full: Hashtag calls for Star Wars boycott

title: Hashtag calls for Star Wars boycott
text:
Hashtag calls for Star Wars boycott Twitter user says film 'promotes white genocide' Published On: 26 m Tweet Disney/LucasFilm 
A Twitter hashtag that began appearing Sunday evening calls for a boycott to the new Star Wars movie. 
Some of those using the hashtag are claiming "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" is "promoting white genocide," as tweeted by an account called End Cultural Marxism. 
The film is presumed to contain a lead stormtrooper role played by black actor John Boyega. Quick Clicks 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' trailer premiering on... 
Another account, called Critical Spooking, tweeted the hashtag and said the new film is "nothing more than a social justice propaganda piece that alienates it's (sic) core audience of young white males." 
According to the Hollywood Reporter, mentioned that past installments in the Star Wars franchise have included leads played by actors of color, including the fact that James Earl Jones voiced iconic villain Darth Vader throughout the original trilogy. 
The final trailer for the highly anticipated film aired Monday evening during halftime of Monday Night Football to much fanfare. Distributed by LAKANA. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
